description: From French filigrane, from Italian filigrana, from Latin fīlum (“thread”) + grānum (“grain”).

entries.meaning: A delicate and intricate ornamentation made from platinum, gold or silver (or sometimes other metal) twisted wire.
A design resembling such intricate ornamentation.

verbs.description: filigree (third-person singular simple present filigrees, present participle filigreeing, simple past and past participle filigreed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To decorate something with intricate ornamentation made from gold or silver twisted wire.
